summary:
WhatsApp to End Support for Older Android Phones Starting January 1, 2025

Publication Date: Not specified; Source: Financial Express

In a significant move, Meta announced that WhatsApp will cease to support older Android devices beginning January 1, 2025. Users operating on Android KitKat and older versions will be unable to run the app, impacting millions globally.

Key Points

  • WhatsApp support will end for all Android devices running KitKat or older.
  • Users are encouraged to back up their data to newer devices.
  • Affected brands include Samsung, Motorola, HTC, LG, and Sony.
  • Meta previously announced similar plans for older iPhones.
  • Important backup tips provided to help users transition smoothly.

"If you are still using one of these devices as your daily driver, the logical way forward is to back up all your WhatsApp data to a newer device."

As WhatsApp phases out support for older systems, users must take proactive measures to move their data to updated devices to avoid losing access to their chat histories.
newTitle: WhatsApp to End Support for Older Android Phones Starting January 1, 2025

title: Which Continent Is 90% Covered By Ice? - Jagran Josh
summary:
Which Continent Is 90% Covered By Ice?

Date: 23, Dec 2024

Source: jagranjosh.com

Antarctica, the coldest continent on Earth, is covered by ice that constitutes about 90% of its land area, playing a vital role in global climate regulation.

  • Antarctica contains over 90% of its landmass under thick ice.
  • It holds approximately 60% of the world's fresh water.
  • Temperatures in Antarctica can drop below -60°C (-76°F).
  • No permanent human settlements exist; only temporary research stations.
  • Antarctica’s glaciers are critical for global sea levels.
  • Diverse wildlife such as penguins and seals are adapted to the harsh conditions.
  • Home to international research stations studying climate change and other scientific fields.
"Antarctica is crucial for understanding Earth's climate and ecosystems."

This article emphasizes Antarctica's significance in global climate systems and the extreme conditions that define its environment.
newTitle: Which Continent Is 90% Covered By Ice?

title: 5 Unique methods astronauts use to maintain hygiene at International Space Station - India.com
summary:
5 Unique Methods Astronauts Use to Maintain Hygiene at the International Space Station

Publication Date: December 2024 Source: India.com

Astronauts on the International Space Station (ISS) face unique challenges when it comes to hygiene due to the lack of traditional bathing facilities. Here are five creative methods they use to stay clean while orbiting the Earth.

  • Astronauts brush their teeth with minimal water and wipe off excess toothpaste.
  • They use no-rinse shampoo for their hair, rubbing it in and towel-drying it without rinsing.
  • No-rinse body wipes replace baths for personal cleaning.
  • Instead of washing clothes, they wear disposable ones which are thrown away after use.
  • The crew regularly disinfects surfaces in the spacecraft to prevent bacteria build-up.
They routinely wipe down the spacecraft’s surfaces with disinfectant wipes and vacuum-cleaner-like devices to prevent bacteria from building up.

Maintaining hygiene in space is crucial for health and wellbeing, showcasing the innovative adaptations required for life beyond Earth.
newTitle: 5 Unique Methods Astronauts Use to Maintain Hygiene at the International Space Station

Fact Check: Can bamboo layer and coconut oil make vitiligo disappear in a few days? - Medical Dialogues
summary:
Can Bamboo Layer and Coconut Oil Make Vitiligo Disappear in a Few Days?

Publication Date: [Insert Date]   Source: Medical Dialogues

The article discusses a claim circulating on Instagram that a mixture of bamboo powder and coconut oil can cure vitiligo in just a few days. This claim is identified as false, with evidence showing that while bamboo and coconut oil may have some benefits for skin health, they do not cure vitiligo.

Key Points:

  • The claim that bamboo powder mixed with coconut oil can cure vitiligo is false.
  • Proper diagnosis and treatment are essential for vitiligo management.
  • Dr. Shireen Furtado explains evidence-based treatment options like topical corticosteroids and phototherapy.
  • No scientific evidence supports the use of bamboo powder for treating vitiligo.
  • Vitiligo is a complex condition that requires medical oversight.
Dr. Shireen Furtado: "No, such remedies are not scientifically proven to cure vitiligo. Effective treatments require time and medical guidance."

The conclusion emphasizes the importance of consulting healthcare professionals for effective vitiligo treatments, as unverified remedies can be harmful.
newTitle: Can Bamboo and Coconut Oil Cure Vitiligo? A Fact Check

title: Can homemade juice cause blood sugar spikes in diabetic patients? - Asianet Newsable
summary:
Can Homemade Juice Spike Blood Sugar in Diabetics?

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Asianet Newsable

This article discusses the potential risks of homemade juice for diabetic patients, emphasizing that it can lead to significant blood sugar spikes.

  • Diabetics should avoid all types of juice, both homemade and store-bought, due to high glucose content.
  • Juicing fruits concentrates natural sugars, which can rapidly increase blood sugar levels.
  • Whole fruits contain fiber that helps regulate blood sugar; juice lacks this fiber, causing quicker absorption of sugar.
  • Juice empties the stomach faster than whole fruits, leading to increased hunger and more frequent eating.
  • Juicing reduces essential nutrients, such as fiber, vitamins, and minerals, making juice less nutritious.
  • Choosing whole fruits over juice is recommended for better blood sugar balance and sustained energy.
“Diabetics should choose whole fruits over juice for fiber and nutrients, balancing blood sugar and providing sustained energy.”

In conclusion, while homemade juice may seem healthy, it poses risks for diabetics and is often less nutritious than whole fruits.
newTitle: Can Homemade Juice Spike Blood Sugar in Diabetics?

title: JSW Steel, Tata Steel, Jindal Steel and Power: Steel stocks rally up to 2%; here is why - Upstox
summary:
Steel Stocks Rally as India Probes Increase in Steel Imports

Date: December 23, 2023

Source: PTI

Shares of leading steel manufacturers like JSW Steel, Tata Steel, and Jindal Steel saw gains of up to 2% following a government investigation into rising steel imports based on a complaint from the Indian Steel Association.

  • JSW Steel shares traded 2% higher at ₹935.45.
  • Tata Steel shares increased by 2% reaching ₹143.42.
  • SAIL stocks rose 1.5% to ₹117.94.
  • The Directorate General of Trade Remedies (DGTR) initiated an investigation into 'Non-Alloy and Alloy Steel Flat Products'.
  • The investigation follows claims of significant injury to the domestic steel industry due to increased imports.
  • The Indian Steel Association has requested the imposition of a safeguard duty on these imports to protect local manufacturers.
The applicant has alleged that there is a 'recent, sudden, sharp, and significant' increase in the volume of imports, which has caused 'significant' injury to the domestic industry in India.

This investigation aims to provide a level playing field for domestic stakeholders amid rising import volumes and potential impacts on the local market.
newTitle: Steel Stocks Rally as India Probes Increase in Steel Imports

title: Epigamia CEO Rohan Mirchandani dies of sudden cardiac arrest: What causes it in your 40s? - The Indian Express
summary:
Epigamia CEO Rohan Mirchandani dies of sudden cardiac arrest: What causes it in your 40s?

Publication Date: December 23, 2024 | Source: Indian Express

The sudden passing of Rohan Mirchandani, CEO of Epigamia, has raised concerns about the rising incidence of sudden cardiac arrest among younger individuals, highlighting the need for early heart health checks in India.

  • Sudden cardiac arrest can affect anyone regardless of age, with individuals over 40 facing higher risks from coronary artery disease.
  • Heart attacks and sudden cardiac arrests are different; heart attacks involve blocked arteries, while cardiac arrests are typically related to electrical issues in the heart.
  • Younger individuals (under 35) may experience sudden cardiac arrest due to congenital defects or genetic abnormalities like Hypertrophic Cardiomyopathy.
  • Recognizing the signs and symptoms is crucial, as there is a very limited window for effective treatment—primarily CPR and defibrillation.
  • Public awareness and training in CPR is significantly lower in India compared to countries like the US, where 85% of individuals are trained.
“We should make a serious attempt to keep our heart conditions in check early in life as we are genetically more prone to developing heart diseases.”

In conclusion, Rohan Mirchandani’s passing serves as a vital reminder about the importance of heart health checks and awareness around cardiac conditions, particularly in a country facing high rates of heart disease.
newTitle: Epigamia CEO Rohan Mirchandani dies of sudden cardiac arrest: Understanding the Causes

title: Full-body MRI scans may not be as effective as believed to be; know why - The Indian Express
summary:
Full-body MRI scans may not be as effective as believed to be; know why

Date: [Insert publication date]

Source: [Insert source]

Full body MRI scans have surged in popularity, but a new study reveals they may not be as effective for detecting diseases as previously thought.

  • The study, led by Adam Taylor from Lancaster University, analyzed 16,000 brain MRI scans.
  • Findings: MRI scans detected serious conditions in only a small percentage of cases—1.4% for the brain, 1.3% for the chest, and 1.9% for the abdomen.
  • High rates of false positives were reported, with 97 false positives in 1,000 breast scans.
  • Experts agree on the limitations of full-body MRI scans for preventive measures.
  • While they can detect certain abnormalities, many preventable diseases might remain undetected.
“The risk of overdiagnosis and overtreatment is a significant concern.” - Dr. Rahul Gautam

In conclusion, while full-body MRI scans offer insights into certain health conditions, their effectiveness as preventive diagnostics remains controversial due to limitations in detecting various diseases.
newTitle: Effectiveness of Full-Body MRI Scans Questioned by New Study
